030package squidpony.squidmath;
031
032import java.io.Serializable;
033
034/**
035 * A wide range of noise functions that can all be called from one configurable object. Originally from Jordan Peck's
036 * FastNoise library, hence the name (these functions are sometimes, but not always, very fast for noise that doesn't
037 * use the GPU). This implements Noise2D, Noise3D, Noise4D, Noise5D, and Noise6D, and this is the fastest continuous
038 * noise algorithm in the library. It also allows the most configuration of any noise generator here, and the API is
039 * quite large. Some key parts to keep in mind:
040 * <ul>
041 *     <li>The noise type, set with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}, controls what algorithm this uses to generate noise, and
042 *     affects most of the other options. Choose a "_FRACTAL" noise type like {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} (the default) if
043 *     you want to use any of the fractal options, like octaves, lacunarity, gain, or fractal type.</li>
044 *     <li>The frequency, set with {@link #setFrequency(float)}, affects how quickly significant changes in output can
045 *     occur over a given span of input values. It defaults to {@code 1f/32f}, though you should try setting this to
046 *     {@code 1f} if results look strange.</li>
047 *     <li>If your noise type is one of the fractal varieties ({@link #VALUE_FRACTAL}, {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL},
048 *     {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL}, {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL}, or {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL}):
049 *     <ul>
050 *         <li>Fractal noise can set a fractal type with {@link #setFractalType(int)}, which defaults to {@link #FBM}
051 *         (almost the same as {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Layered2D}), and can also be set to
052 *         {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} (almost the same as {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Ridged2D}) or {@link #BILLOW}
053 *         (related to RIDGED_MULTI in some ways). The noise type affects how the other fractal options work, and has a
054 *         very strong effect on the appearance of the noise when it changes.</li>
055 *         <li>Octaves, set with {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, are how many "layers" of noise this will calculate on
056 *         each call to get fractal noise. Each octave has its frequency changed based on lacunarity (set with
057 *         {@link #setFractalLacunarity(float)}), and contributes a different amount to the resulting value, based on
058 *         gain (set with {@link #setFractalGain(float)}). Generally, more octaves result in more detail and slower
059 *         generation times. {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} and {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL} only really look like noise when they
060 *         use more than one octave.</li>
061 *         <li>Lacunarity may occasionally need adjustment, but usually you're fine with setting it to 2.0 or 0.5, with
062 *         the appearance informing the decision. I think lacunarity means something related to the width of a crescent,
063 *         and refers to the exponential shape of a graph of frequency as octaves are added. It defaults to 2.0, and you
064 *         can imitate {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.InverseLayered2D} by setting it to 0.5.</li>
065 *         <li>Gain usually only needs changing if lacunarity is changed, but they can be adjusted independently. You
066 *         probably will get the best results if gain is equal to {@code 1f / lacunarity}, or close to that.</li>
067 *     </ul>
068 *     </li>
069 *     <li>In some cases, you may want unusual or symmetrical artifacts in noise; you can make this happen with
070 *     {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, giving it a {@link FlawedPointHash} or a point hash you made, and setting
071 *     noise type to {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} (or {@link #CUBIC}).</li>
072 *     <li>The {@link #CELLULAR} noise type has lots of extra configuration, and not all of it is well-documented, but
073 *     experimenting with settings like {@link #setCellularReturnType(int)} and
074 *     {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)} is a good way to see if it can do what you want.</li>
075 * </ul>
076 */
077public class FastNoise implements Serializable, Noise.Noise2D, Noise.Noise3D, Noise.Noise4D, Noise.Noise5D, Noise.Noise6D {
078    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3L;
079    /**
080     * Simple, very fast but very low-quality noise that forms a grid of squares, with their values blending at shared
081     * edges somewhat.
082     * <br>
083     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/egjotwb.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
084     * <br>
085     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
086     */
087    public static final int VALUE = 0,
088    /**
089     * Simple, very fast but very low-quality noise that forms a grid of squares, with their values blending at shared
090     * edges somewhat; this version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more, but
091     * none of these really disguise the grid it uses.
092     * <br>
093     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/egjotwb.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
094     * <br>
095     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
096     */
097    VALUE_FRACTAL = 1,
098    /**
099     * Also called Gradient Noise or Classic Perlin noise, this is fast and mid-to-low-quality in 2D, but slows down
100     * significantly in higher dimensions while mostly improving in quality. This may have a noticeable grid at 90
101     * degree angles (and a little at 45 degree angles).
102     * <br>
103     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/MO7hwSI.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
104     * <br>
105     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
106     */
107    PERLIN = 2,
108    /**
109     * Also called Gradient Noise or Classic Perlin noise, this is fast and mid-to-low-quality in 2D, but slows down
110     * significantly in higher dimensions while mostly improving in quality. This may have a noticeable grid at 90
111     * degree angles (and a little at 45 degree angles). This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)},
112     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more.
113     * <br>
114     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/MO7hwSI.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
115     * <br>
116     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
117     */
118    PERLIN_FRACTAL = 3,
119    /**
120     * Also called Improved Perlin noise, this is always fast but tends to have better quality in lower dimensions. This
121     * may have a noticeable grid at 60 degree angles, made of regular triangles in 2D.
122     * <br>
123     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wg3kq5A.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
124     * <br>
125     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
126     */
127    SIMPLEX = 4,
128    /**
129     * Also called Improved Perlin noise, this is always fast but tends to have better quality in lower dimensions. This
130     * may have a noticeable grid at 60 degree angles, made of regular triangles in 2D. This version can use
131     * {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more; it is the default noise type if none is
132     * specified.
133     * <br>
134     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wg3kq5A.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
135     * <br>
136     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
137     */
138    SIMPLEX_FRACTAL = 5,
139    /**
140     * Creates a Voronoi diagram of 2D or 3D space and fills cells based on the {@link #setCellularReturnType(int)},
141     * {@link #setCellularDistanceFunction(int)}, and possibly the {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)}. This is
142     * more of an advanced usage, but can yield useful results when oddly-shaped areas should have similar values.
143     * <br>
144     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ScRves7.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
145     * <br>
146     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
147     */
148    CELLULAR = 6,
149    /**
150     * Purely chaotic, non-continuous random noise per position; looks like static on a TV screen.
151     * <br>
152     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/vBtISSx.jpg">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
153     * <br>
154     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
155     */
156    WHITE_NOISE = 7,
157    /**
158     * A simple kind of noise that gets a random float for each vertex of a square or cube, and interpolates between all
159     * of them to get a smoothly changing value (using cubic interpolation, also called {@link #HERMITE}, of course).
160     * If you're changing the point hashing algorithm with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, you should usually use
161     * this or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} if you want to see any aesthetically-desirable artifacts in the hash.
162     * <br>
163     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/foV90pn.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
164     * <br>
165     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
166     */
167    CUBIC = 8,
168    /**
169     * A simple kind of noise that gets a random float for each vertex of a square or cube, and interpolates between all
170     * of them to get a smoothly changing value (using cubic interpolation, also called {@link #HERMITE}, of course).
171     * This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more.
172     * If you're changing the point hashing algorithm with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, you should usually use
173     * this or {@link #CUBIC} if you want to see any aesthetically-desirable artifacts in the hash.
174     * <br>
175     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/foV90pn.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
176     * <br>
177     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
178     */
179    CUBIC_FRACTAL = 9,
180    /**
181     * A novel kind of noise that works in n-dimensions by averaging n+1 value noise calls, all of them rotated around
182     * each other, and with all of the value noise calls after the first adding in the last call's result to part of the
183     * position. This yields rather high-quality noise (especially when comparing one octave of FOAM to one octave of
184     * {@link #PERLIN} or {@link #SIMPLEX}), but is somewhat slow.
185     * <br>
186     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/4ZC9h5t.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
187     * <br>
188     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
189     */
190    FOAM = 10,
191    /**
192     * A novel kind of noise that works in n-dimensions by averaging n+1 value noise calls, all of them rotated around
193     * each other, and with all of the value noise calls after the first adding in the last call's result to part of the
194     * position. This yields rather high-quality noise (especially when comparing one octave of FOAM to one octave of
195     * {@link #PERLIN} or {@link #SIMPLEX}), but is somewhat slow. This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)},
196     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more, and usually doesn't need as many octaves as PERLIN or SIMPLEX to
197     * attain comparable quality.
198     * <br>
199     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/4ZC9h5t.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
200     * <br>
201     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
202     */
203    FOAM_FRACTAL = 11,
204    /**
205     * A simple combination of {@link #SIMPLEX} and {@link #VALUE} noise, averaging a call to each and then distorting
206     * the result's distribution so it isn't as centrally-biased. The result is somewhere between {@link #FOAM} and
207     * {@link #SIMPLEX}, and has less angular bias than Simplex or Value. This gets its name from how it mixes two
208     * different geometric honeycombs (a triangular one for 2D Simplex noise and a square one for 2D Value noise).
209     * <br>
210     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/bMEPiBA.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
211     * <br>
212     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
213     */
214    HONEY = 12,
215    /**
216     * A simple combination of {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} and {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL} noise, averaging a call to each and
217     * then distorting the result's distribution so it isn't as centrally-biased. The result is somewhere between
218     * {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} and {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL}, and has less angular bias than Simplex or Value. This gets
219     * its name from how it mixes two different geometric honeycombs (a triangular one for 2D Simplex noise and a square
220     * one for 2D Value noise). This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and
221     * more, and usually doesn't need as many octaves as PERLIN or SIMPLEX to attain comparable quality, though it
222     * drastically improves with just two octaves.
223     * <br>
224     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/bMEPiBA.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
225     * <br>
226     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
227     */
228    HONEY_FRACTAL = 13;
229
230    /**
231     * Simple linear interpolation. May result in artificial-looking noise.
232     * Meant to be used with {@link #setInterpolation(int)}.
233     */
234    public static final int LINEAR = 0;
235    /**
236     * Cubic interpolation via Hermite spline, more commonly known as "smoothstep".
237     * Can be very natural-looking, but can also have problems in higher dimensions
238     * (including 3D when used with normals) with seams appearing.
239     * Meant to be used with {@link #setInterpolation(int)}.
240     */
241    public static final int HERMITE = 1;
242    /**
243     * Quintic interpolation, sometimes known as "smootherstep".
244     * This has somewhat steeper transitions than {@link #HERMITE}, but doesn't
245     * have any issues with seams.
246     * Meant to be used with {@link #setInterpolation(int)}.
247     */
248    public static final int QUINTIC = 2;
249
250    public static final int FBM = 0, BILLOW = 1, RIDGED_MULTI = 2;
251
252    public static final int EUCLIDEAN = 0, MANHATTAN = 1, NATURAL = 2;
253
254    public static final int CELL_VALUE = 0, NOISE_LOOKUP = 1, DISTANCE = 2, DISTANCE_2 = 3,
255            DISTANCE_2_ADD = 4, DISTANCE_2_SUB = 5, DISTANCE_2_MUL = 6, DISTANCE_2_DIV = 7;
256
257    private int seed;
258    protected float frequency = 0.03125f;
259    protected int interpolation = HERMITE;
260    
261    private int noiseType = SIMPLEX_FRACTAL;
262
263    private int octaves = 1;
264    private float lacunarity = 2f;
265    private float gain = 0.5f;
266
267    private boolean fractalSpiral = false;
268    private int fractalType = FBM;
269
270    private float fractalBounding;
271
272    private int cellularDistanceFunction = EUCLIDEAN;
273    private int cellularReturnType = CELL_VALUE;
274    private FastNoise cellularNoiseLookup;
275    private float gradientPerturbAmp = 1f / 0.45f;
276
277    private float foamSharpness = 1f;
278
279    private IPointHash pointHash = new IntPointHash();
280
281    /**
282     * A publicly available FastNoise object with seed 1337, frequency 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise using
283     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType, 2f lacunarity and 0.5f gain. It's encouraged to use methods that temporarily configure
284     * this variable, like {@link #getNoiseWithSeed(float, float, int)} rather than changing its settings and using a
285     * method that needs that lasting configuration, like {@link #getConfiguredNoise(float, float)}.
286     */
287    public static final FastNoise instance = new FastNoise();
288    /**
289     * A constructor that takes no parameters, and uses all default settings with a seed of 1337. An example call to
290     * this would be {@code new FastNoise()}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1
291     * octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
292     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
293     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
294     */
295    public FastNoise() {
296        this(1337);
297    }
298
299    /**
300     * A constructor that takes only a parameter for the FastNoise's seed, which should produce different results for
301     * any different seeds. An example call to this would be {@code new FastNoise(1337)}, which makes noise with the
302     * seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count,
303     * it always uses 1 even for the SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call
304     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain
305     * (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
306     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
307     */
308    public FastNoise(int seed) {
309        this.seed = seed;
310        calculateFractalBounding();
311    }
312    /**
313     * A constructor that takes two parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
314     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
315     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
316     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
317     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
318     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
319     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
320     */
321    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency)
322    {
323        this(seed, frequency, SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
324    }
325    /**
326     * A constructor that takes a few parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
327     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
328     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for 
329     * noiseTypes like SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, but using a fractal noiseType can make sense if you call
330     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
331     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
332     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
333     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
334     */
335    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType)
336    {
337        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * A constructor that takes several parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
342     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
343     * frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
344     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
345     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
346     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
347     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
348     */
349    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves)
350    {
351        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, octaves, 2f, 0.5f);
352    }
353
354    /**
355     * A constructor that takes a lot of parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
356     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4, 0.5f, 2f)}, which makes noise with a
357     * lower frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and the "inverse" effect on how those octaves work (which makes
358     * the extra added octaves be more significant to the final result and also have a lower frequency, while normally
359     * added octaves have a higher frequency and tend to have a minor effect on the large-scale shape of the noise).
360     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
361     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
362     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
363     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
364     * @param lacunarity typically 2.0, or 0.5 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode) 
365     * @param gain typically 0.5, or 2.0 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode)
366     */
367    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves, float lacunarity, float gain)
368    {
369        this.seed = seed;
370        this.frequency = Math.max(0.0001f, frequency);
371        this.noiseType = noiseType;
372        this.octaves = octaves;
373        this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
374        this.gain = gain;
375        calculateFractalBounding();
376    }
377
378    /**
379     * Copy constructor; copies all non-temporary fields from  {@code other} into this. This uses the same reference to
380     * an {@link IPointHash} set with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)} and to another FastNoise set with
381     * {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)}, but otherwise everything it copies is a primitive.
382     * @param other another FastNoise, which must not be null
383     */
384    public FastNoise(final FastNoise other) {
385        this(other.seed, other.frequency, other.noiseType, other.octaves, other.lacunarity, other.gain);
386        this.pointHash = other.pointHash;
387        this.interpolation = other.interpolation;
388        this.gradientPerturbAmp = other.gradientPerturbAmp;
389        this.cellularReturnType = other.cellularReturnType;
390        this.cellularDistanceFunction = other.cellularDistanceFunction;
391        this.cellularNoiseLookup = other.cellularNoiseLookup;
392    }
393
394    protected static float dotf(final float[] g, final float x, final float y) {
395        return g[0] * x + g[1] * y;
396    }
397
398    /**
399     * @return Returns the seed used by this object
400     */
401    public int getSeed() {
402        return seed;
403    }
404
405    /**
406     * Sets the seed used for all noise types, as a long.
407     * If this is not called, defaults to 1337L.
408     * @param seed a seed as a long
409     */
410    public void setSeed(int seed) {
411        this.seed = seed;
412    }
413
414    /**
415     * Sets the frequency for all noise types. If this is not called, it defaults to 0.03125f (or 1f/32f).
416     * This setter validates the frequency, and won't set it to a float less than 0.0001f, which is small enough that
417     * floating-point precision could be an issue. Lots of things may expect this to be higher than the default,
418     * especially code that is meant to be compatible across {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Noise2D} and similar
419     * interfaces; try setting frequency to {@code 1.0f} if you experience issues.
420     * @param frequency the frequency for all noise types, as a positive non-zero float
421     */
422    public void setFrequency(float frequency) {
423        this.frequency = Math.max(0.0001f, frequency);
424    }
425
426    /**
427     * Gets the frequency for all noise types. The default is 0.03125f, or 1f/32f.
428     * @return the frequency for all noise types, which should be a positive non-zero float
429     */
430    public float getFrequency()
431    {
432        return frequency;
433    }
434
435    /**
436     * Changes the interpolation method used to smooth between noise values, using one of the following constants from
437     * this class (lowest to highest quality): {@link #LINEAR} (0), {@link #HERMITE} (1), or {@link #QUINTIC} (2). If
438     * this is not called, it defaults to HERMITE. This is used in Value, Perlin, and Position Perturbing.
439     * @param interpolation an int (0, 1, or 2) corresponding to a constant from this class for an interpolation type
440     */
441    public void setInterpolation(int interpolation) {
442        this.interpolation = interpolation;
443    }

445    /**

579    /**
580     * Returns true if this uses a spiraling rotation as octaves are added to fractal noise.
581     * This mode affects {@link #BILLOW} and {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} fractal types, but not
582     * {@link #FBM}. It changes {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL}, {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL},
583     * {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL}, and {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} noise types, but not
584     * {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} or {@link #HONEY_FRACTAL} because those show no real improvement
585     * with this on. This mode defaults to false if not set.
586     * @return true if using fractal spiral mode, false otherwise
587     */
588    public boolean isFractalSpiral() {
589        return fractalSpiral;
590    }

592    /**
593     * Sets the fractal spiral mode on or off; if on, this uses a spiraling rotation as octaves are added to
594     * fractal noise. This mode affects {@link #BILLOW} and {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} fractal types, but not
595     * {@link #FBM}. It changes {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL}, {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL},
596     * {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL}, and {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} noise types, but not
597     * {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} or {@link #HONEY_FRACTAL} because those show no real improvement
598     * with this on. This mode defaults to false if not set.
599     * @param fractalSpiral true to set fractal spiral mode on, false to set it off
600     */
601    public void setFractalSpiral(boolean fractalSpiral) {
602        this.fractalSpiral = fractalSpiral;
603    }

605    /**
606     * Gets the "sharpness" for the {@link #FOAM} and {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} noise types, which is usually
607     * around 0.25f to 2.0f, and defaults to 1.0f. High values produce extreme results more often, and
608     * low values produce mid-range values more often.
609     * @return the current "sharpness" {@link #FOAM} and {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} noise types
610     */
611    public float getFoamSharpness() {
612        return foamSharpness;
613    }
614
615    /**
616     * Only used with {@link #FOAM} and {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} noise types, this affects how often the
617     * noise will produce very high and very low results (more often with high values of foamSharpness),
618     * as opposed to mid-range (more often with low values of foamSharpness).
619     * <br>
620     * This defaults to 1.0f if not set.
621     * @param foamSharpness higher results (above 1) tend to produce extremes, lower results (below 1) produce mid-range
622     */
623    public void setFoamSharpness(float foamSharpness) {
624        this.foamSharpness = foamSharpness;
625    }

627    /**
628     * Gets the point hash, an object implementing {@link IPointHash} that is used to take 2 or more
629     * coordinates and a seed and produce a usually-random-seeming hash value. You may want to use a
630     * flawed IPointHash (one that is not random) for artistic reasons, like
631     * {@link FlawedPointHash.QuiltHash} or {@link FlawedPointHash.CubeHash}, but these mostly work
632     * well when the noise type is {@link #CUBIC} or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL}.
633     * <br>
634     * The default setting is an {@link IntPointHash}.
635     * @return the current IPointHash used, such as the default {@link IntPointHash}
636     */
637    public IPointHash getPointHash() {
638        return pointHash;
639    }
640
641    /**
642     * Sets the point hash, an object implementing {@link IPointHash} that is used to take 2 or more
643     * coordinates and a seed and produce a usually-random-seeming hash value. You may want to use a
644     * flawed IPointHash (one that is not random) for artistic reasons, like
645     * {@link FlawedPointHash.QuiltHash} or {@link FlawedPointHash.CubeHash}, but these mostly work
646     * well when the noise type is {@link #CUBIC} or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL}.
647     * <br>
648     * The default setting is an {@link IntPointHash}.
649     * @param hash an IPointHash; will be ignored if null
650     */
651    public void setPointHash(IPointHash hash){
652        if(hash != null) this.pointHash = hash;
653    }

814    protected static int fastFloor(float f) {
815        return (f >= 0 ? (int) f : (int) f - 1);
816    }
817
818
819    protected static int fastRound(float f) {
820        return (f >= 0) ? (int) (f + 0.5f) : (int) (f - 0.5f);
821    }
822
823
824    private static float lerp(float a, float b, float t) {
825        return a + t * (b - a);
826    }
827
828
829    protected static float hermiteInterpolator(float t) {
830        return t * t * (3 - 2 * t);
831    }
832
833
834    protected static float quinticInterpolator(float t) {
835        return t * t * t * (t * (t * 6 - 15) + 10);
836    }
837
838    protected static float cubicLerp(float a, float b, float c, float d, float t) {
839        float p = (d - c) - (a - b);
840        return t * (t * t * p + t * ((a - b) - p) + (c - a)) + b;
841    }
842
843    private void calculateFractalBounding() {
844        float amp = gain;
845        float ampFractal = 1;
846        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
847            ampFractal += amp;
848            amp *= gain;
849        }
850        fractalBounding = 1 / ampFractal;
851    }

853    private float valCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y) {
854        return (hashAll(x, y, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
855    }
856
857    private float valCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z) {
858        return (hashAll(x, y, z, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
859    }
860
861    private float valCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w) {
862        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
863    }
864
865    private float valCoord5D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u) {
866        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
867    }
868
869    private float valCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v) {
870        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
871    }

873    protected float gradCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y, float xd, float yd) {
874        final float[] g = grad2f[hash256(x, y, seed)];
875        return xd * g[0] + yd * g[1];
876    }
877
878    protected float gradCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, float xd, float yd, float zd) {
879        final Float3 g = GRAD_3D[hash32(x, y, z, seed)];
880        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z;
881    }
882
883    protected float gradCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd) {
884        final int hash = hash256(x, y, z, w, seed) & 0xFC;
885        return xd * grad4f[hash] + yd * grad4f[hash + 1] + zd * grad4f[hash + 2] + wd * grad4f[hash + 3];
886    }
887
888    protected float gradCoord5D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u,
889                                       float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd, float ud) {
890        final Float5 g = grad5f[hash256(x, y, z, w, u, seed)];
891        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z + wd * g.w + ud * g.u;
892    }
893
894    protected float gradCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v,
895                                       float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd, float ud, float vd) {
896        final Float6 g = grad6f[hash256(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed)];
897        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z + wd * g.w + ud * g.u + vd * g.v;
898    }

925    /**
926     * After being configured with the setters in this class, such as {@link #setNoiseType(int)},
927     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
928     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 2D.
929     * @param x
930     * @param y
931     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
932     */
933    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y) {
934        x *= frequency;
935        y *= frequency;
936
937        switch (noiseType) {
938            case VALUE:
939                return singleValue(seed, x, y);
940            case VALUE_FRACTAL:
941                switch (fractalType) {
942                    case BILLOW:
943                        return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y);
944                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
945                        return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
946                    default:
947                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
948                }
949            case FOAM:
950                return singleFoam(seed, x, y);
951            case FOAM_FRACTAL:
952                switch (fractalType) {
953                    case BILLOW:
954                        return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y);
955                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
956                        return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
957                    default:
958                        return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y);
959                }
960            case HONEY:
961                return singleHoney(seed, x, y);
962            case HONEY_FRACTAL:
963                switch (fractalType) {
964                    case BILLOW:
965                        return singleHoneyFractalBillow(x, y);
966                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
967                        return singleHoneyFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
968                    default:
969                        return singleHoneyFractalFBM(x, y);
970                }
971            case PERLIN:
972                return singlePerlin(seed, x, y);
973            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
974                switch (fractalType) {
975                    case BILLOW:
976                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y);
977                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
978                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
979                    default:
980                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y);
981                }
982            case SIMPLEX_FRACTAL:
983                switch (fractalType) {
984                    case BILLOW:
985                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y);
986                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
987                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
988                    default:
989                        return singleSimplexFractalFBM(x, y);
990                }
991            case CELLULAR:
992                switch (cellularReturnType) {
993                    case CELL_VALUE:
994                    case NOISE_LOOKUP:
995                    case DISTANCE:
996                        return singleCellular(x, y);
997                    default:
998                        return singleCellular2Edge(x, y);
999                }
1000            case WHITE_NOISE:
1001                return getWhiteNoise(x, y);
1002            case CUBIC:
1003                return singleCubic(seed, x, y);
1004            case CUBIC_FRACTAL:
1005                switch (fractalType) {
1006                    case BILLOW:
1007                        return singleCubicFractalBillow(x, y);
1008                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1009                        return singleCubicFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1010                    default:
1011                        return singleCubicFractalFBM(x, y);
1012                }
1013            default:
1014                return singleSimplex(seed, x, y);
1015        }
1016    }

1370    // White Noise
1371
1372    private int floatToIntMixed(final float f) {
1373        final int i = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(f);
1374        return i ^ i >>> 16;
1375    }
1376
1377    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y) {
1378        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1379        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1380
1381        return valCoord2D(seed, xi, yi);
1382    }
1383
1384    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z) {
1385        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1386        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1387        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1388
1389        return valCoord3D(seed, xi, yi, zi);
1390    }
1391    
1392    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1393        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1394        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1395        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1396        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1397
1398        return valCoord4D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi);
1399    }
1400    
1401    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1402        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1403        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1404        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1405        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1406        int ui = floatToIntMixed(u);
1407
1408        return valCoord5D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi, ui);
1409    }
1410
1411    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1412        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1413        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1414        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1415        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1416        int ui = floatToIntMixed(u);
1417        int vi = floatToIntMixed(v);
1418
1419        return valCoord6D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi, ui, vi);
1420    }
1421    
1422    // Value Noise
1423    //x should be premultiplied by 0xD1B55
1424    //y should be premultiplied by 0xABC99
1425    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, int s) {
1426        s += x ^ y;
1427        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1428    }
1429    //x should be premultiplied by 0xDB4F1
1430    //y should be premultiplied by 0xBBE05
1431    //z should be premultiplied by 0xA0F2F
1432    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, int s) {
1433        s += x ^ y ^ z;
1434        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1435    }
1436    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE19B1
1437    //y should be premultiplied by 0xC6D1D
1438    //z should be premultiplied by 0xAF36D
1439    //w should be premultiplied by 0x9A695
1440    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, int s) {
1441        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w;
1442        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1443    }
1444
1445    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE60E3
1446    //y should be premultiplied by 0xCEBD7
1447    //z should be premultiplied by 0xB9C9B
1448    //w should be premultiplied by 0xA6F57
1449    //u should be premultiplied by 0x9609D
1450    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, final int u, int s) {
1451        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w ^ u;
1452        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1453    }
1454
1455    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE95E1
1456    //y should be premultiplied by 0xD4BC7
1457    //z should be premultiplied by 0xC1EDB
1458    //w should be premultiplied by 0xB0C8B
1459    //u should be premultiplied by 0xA127B
1460    //v should be premultiplied by 0x92E85
1461    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, final int u, final int v, int s) {
1462        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w ^ u ^ v;
1463        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1464    }

1466
1467    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y) {
1468        x *= frequency;
1469        y *= frequency;
1470
1471        switch (fractalType) {
1472            case FBM:
1473                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
1474            case BILLOW:
1475                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y);
1476            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1477                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1478            default:
1479                return 0;
1480        }
1481    }
1482
1483    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
1484        int seed = this.seed;
1485        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y);
1486        float amp = 1;
1487
1488        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1489            x *= lacunarity;
1490            y *= lacunarity;
1491
1492            amp *= gain;
1493            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y) * amp;
1494        }
1495
1496        return sum * fractalBounding;
1497    }
1498
1499    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
1500        int seed = this.seed;
1501        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
1502        float amp = 1;
1503
1504        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1505            if(fractalSpiral){
1506                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
1507                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
1508                x = x2; y = y2;
1509            }
1510            x *= lacunarity;
1511            y *= lacunarity;
1512            amp *= gain;
1513            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1514        }
1515
1516        return sum * fractalBounding;
1517    }
1518
1519    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
1520        int seed = this.seed;
1521        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
1522        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1523            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y));
1524            correction += (exp *= 0.5f);
1525            sum += spike * exp;
1526            if(fractalSpiral){
1527                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
1528                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
1529                x = x2; y = y2;
1530            }
1531            x *= lacunarity;
1532            y *= lacunarity;
1533        }
1534        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
1535    }
1536
1537    public float getValue(float x, float y) {
1538        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
1539    }
1540
1541
1542    public float singleValue (int seed, float x, float y) {
1543        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1544        x -= xFloor;
1545        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1546        y -= yFloor;
1547        switch (interpolation) {
1548            case HERMITE:
1549                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1550                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1551                break;
1552            case QUINTIC:
1553                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1554                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1555                break;
1556        }
1557        xFloor *= 0xD1B55;
1558        yFloor *= 0xABC99;
1559        return ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor, seed))
1560                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed)))
1561                * 0x1p-9f;
1562    }
1563
1564    /**
1565     * Produces noise from 0 to 1, instead of the normal -1 to 1.
1566     * @param seed
1567     * @param x
1568     * @param y
1569     * @return noise from 0 to 1.
1570     */
1571    protected float valueNoise (int seed, float x, float y) {
1572        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1573        x -= xFloor;
1574        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
1575        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1576        y -= yFloor;
1577        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
1578        xFloor *= 0xD1B55;
1579        yFloor *= 0xABC99;
1580        return ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor, seed))
1581                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed)))
1582                * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
1583    }
1584    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z) {
1585        x *= frequency;
1586        y *= frequency;
1587        z *= frequency;
1588
1589        switch (fractalType) {
1590            case BILLOW:
1591                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1592            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1593                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1594            default:
1595                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1596        }
1597    }

1603
1604        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1605            x *= lacunarity;
1606            y *= lacunarity;
1607            z *= lacunarity;
1608
1609            amp *= gain;
1610            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z) * amp;
1611        }
1612
1613        return sum * fractalBounding;
1614    }

1667        y -= yFloor;

1689                + z *
1690                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed))
1691                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed)))

1883                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed))
1884                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed)))
1885                        + z *
1886                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed))
1887                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed)))
1888                ))) * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
1889    }
1890
1891    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1892        x *= frequency;
1893        y *= frequency;
1894        z *= frequency;
1895        w *= frequency;
1896        u *= frequency;
1897
1898        switch (fractalType) {
1899            case BILLOW:
1900                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u);
1901            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1902                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u);
1903            default:
1904                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u);
1905        }
1906    }
1907    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1908        int seed = this.seed;
1909        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u);
1910        float amp = 1;
1911
1912        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1913            x *= lacunarity;
1914            y *= lacunarity;
1915            z *= lacunarity;
1916            w *= lacunarity;
1917            u *= lacunarity;
1918            
1919            amp *= gain;
1920            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u) * amp;
1921        }
1922
1923        return sum * fractalBounding;
1924    }
1925
1926    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1927        int seed = this.seed;
1928        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1;
1929        float amp = 1;
1930
1931        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1932            if(fractalSpiral){
1933                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1934                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1935                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1936                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1937                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1938                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
1939            }
1940            x *= lacunarity;
1941            y *= lacunarity;
1942            z *= lacunarity;
1943            w *= lacunarity;
1944            u *= lacunarity;
1945
1946            amp *= gain;
1947            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1948        }
1949
1950        return sum * fractalBounding;
1951    }
1952
1953    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1954        int seed = this.seed;
1955        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
1956        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1957            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u));
1958            correction += (exp *= 0.5f);
1959            sum += spike * exp;
1960            if(fractalSpiral){
1961                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1962                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1963                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1964                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1965                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
1966                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
1967            }
1968            x *= lacunarity;
1969            y *= lacunarity;
1970            z *= lacunarity;
1971            w *= lacunarity;
1972            u *= lacunarity;
1973        }
1974        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
1975    }
1976
1977    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1978        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency, u * frequency);
1979    }

1981    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1982        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1983        x -= xFloor;
1984        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1985        y -= yFloor;
1986        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1987        z -= zFloor;
1988        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
1989        w -= wFloor;
1990        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
1991        u -= uFloor;
1992        switch (interpolation) {
1993            case HERMITE:
1994                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1995                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1996                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
1997                w = hermiteInterpolator(w);
1998                u = hermiteInterpolator(u);
1999                break;
2000            case QUINTIC:
2001                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
2002                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
2003                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
2004                w = quinticInterpolator(w);
2005                u = quinticInterpolator(u);
2006                break; 
2007        }
2008        //0xE60E3, 0xCEBD7, 0xB9C9B, 0xA6F57, 0x9609D, 0x86D51
2009        xFloor *= 0xE60E3;
2010        yFloor *= 0xCEBD7;
2011        zFloor *= 0xB9C9B;
2012        wFloor *= 0xA6F57;
2013        uFloor *= 0x9609D;
2014        return ((1 - u) *
2015                ((1 - w) *
2016                        ((1 - z) *
2017                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2018                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed)))
2019                                + z *
2020                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2021                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))))
2022                        + (w *
2023                        ((1 - z) *
2024                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2025                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
2026                                + z *
2027                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2028                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
2029                        )))
2030                + (u *
2031                ((1 - w) *
2032                        ((1 - z) *
2033                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2034                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))
2035                                + z *
2036                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2037                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))))
2038                        + (w *
2039                        ((1 - z) *
2040                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2041                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))
2042                                + z *
2043                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
2044                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))

2046        ) * 0x1p-9f;

2049    protected float valueNoise(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
2050        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
2051        x -= xFloor;
2052        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
2053        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
2054        y -= yFloor;
2055        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
2056        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
2057        z -= zFloor;
2058        z *= z * (3 - 2 * z);
2059        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
2060        w -= wFloor;
2061        w *= w * (3 - 2 * w);
2062        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
2063        u -= uFloor;
2064        u *= u * (3 - 2 * u);
2065        //0xE60E3, 0xCEBD7, 0xB9C9B, 0xA6F57, 0x9609D, 0x86D51
2066        xFloor *= 0xE60E3;
2067        yFloor *= 0xCEBD7;
2068        zFloor *= 0xB9C9B;
2069        wFloor *= 0xA6F57;
2070        uFloor *= 0x9609D;
2071        return ((1 - u) *
2072                ((1 - w) *
2073                        ((1 - z) *
2074                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2075                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed)))
2076                                + z *
2077                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
2078                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))))
2079                        + (w *
2080                        ((1 - z) *
2081                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2082                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
2083                                + z *
2084                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
2085                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))

2202    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2203        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
2204        x -= xFloor;
2205        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
2206        y -= yFloor;
2207        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
2208        z -= zFloor;
2209        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
2210        w -= wFloor;
2211        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
2212        u -= uFloor;
2213        int vFloor = v >= 0 ? (int) v : (int) v - 1;
2214        v -= vFloor;
2215        switch (interpolation) {
2216            case HERMITE:
2217                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
2218                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
2219                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
2220                w = hermiteInterpolator(w);
2221                u = hermiteInterpolator(u);
2222                v = hermiteInterpolator(v);
2223                break;
2224            case QUINTIC:
2225                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
2226                y = quinticInterpolator(y);

2392                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed))))
2393                                + (w *
2394                                ((1 - z) *
2395                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed))
2396                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed)))
2397                                        + z *
2398                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed))
2399                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed)))
2400                                ))))))
2401        ) * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
2402    }

2404    // Foam Noise
2405
2406    public float getFoam(float x, float y) {
2407        return singleFoam(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
2408    }
2409
2410    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y) {
2411        final float p0 = x;
2412        final float p1 = x * -0.5f + y * 0.8660254037844386f;
2413        final float p2 = x * -0.5f + y * -0.8660254037844387f;
2414
2415        float xin = p2;
2416        float yin = p0;
2417        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin);
2418        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2419        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2420        xin = p1;
2421        yin = p2;
2422        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin);
2423        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2424        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2425        xin = p0;
2426        yin = p1;
2427        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin);
2428        final float result = (a + b + c) * F3f;
2429        final float sharp = foamSharpness * 2.2f;
2430        final float diff = 0.5f - result;
2431        final int sign = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(diff) >> 31, one = sign | 1;
2432        return (((result + sign)) / (Float.MIN_VALUE - sign + (result + sharp * diff) * one) - sign - sign) - 1f;
2433    }
2434
2435    public float getFoamFractal(float x, float y) {
2436        x *= frequency;
2437        y *= frequency;
2438
2439        switch (fractalType) {
2440            case FBM:
2441                return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y);
2442            case BILLOW:
2443                return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y);
2444            case RIDGED_MULTI:
2445                return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
2446            default:
2447                return 0;
2448        }
2449    }
2450
2451    private float singleFoamFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
2452        int seed = this.seed;
2453        float sum = singleFoam(seed, x, y);
2454        float amp = 1, t;
2455
2456        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2457            t = x;
2458            x = y * lacunarity;
2459            y = t * lacunarity;
2460
2461            amp *= gain;
2462            sum += singleFoam(seed + i, x, y) * amp;
2463        }
2464
2465        return sum * fractalBounding;
2466    }
2467
2468    private float singleFoamFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
2469        int seed = this.seed;
2470        float sum = Math.abs(singleFoam(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
2471        float amp = 1, t;
2472
2473        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2474            t = x;
2475            x = y * lacunarity;
2476            y = t * lacunarity;
2477
2478            amp *= gain;
2479            sum += (Math.abs(singleFoam(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2480        }
2481
2482        return sum * fractalBounding;
2483    }
2484
2485    private float singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
2486        int seed = this.seed;
2487        float t;
2488        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
2489        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2490            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleFoam(seed + i, x, y));
2491            correction += (exp *= 0.5f);
2492            sum += spike * exp;
2493            t = x;
2494            x = y * lacunarity;
2495            y = t * lacunarity;
2496        }
2497        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
2498    }

2570    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y, float z){
2571        final float p0 = x;
2572        final float p1 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * 0.9428090415820634f;
2573        final float p2 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * -0.4714045207910317f + z * 0.816496580927726f;
2574        final float p3 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * -0.4714045207910317f + z * -0.816496580927726f;
2575
2576        float xin = p3;
2577        float yin = p2;
2578        float zin = p0;
2579        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin);
2580        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2581        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2582        xin = p0;
2583        yin = p1;
2584        zin = p3;
2585        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin);
2586        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2587        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2588        xin = p1;
2589        yin = p2;
2590        zin = p3;
2591        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin);
2592        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2593        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2594        xin = p0;
2595        yin = p1;
2596        zin = p2;
2597        final float d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin);
2598
2599        final float result = (a + b + c + d) * 0.25f;
2600        final float sharp = foamSharpness * 3.3f;
2601        final float diff = 0.5f - result;
2602        final int sign = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(diff) >> 31, one = sign | 1;
2603        return (((result + sign)) / (Float.MIN_VALUE - sign + (result + sharp * diff) * one) - sign - sign) - 1f;
2604    }

2786    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {

2791        final float p4 = x * -0.0208603044412437f + y * -0.3155296974329846f + z * -0.316227766016838f + w * -0.44721359549995804f + u *  0.7745966692414833f;
2792        final float p5 = x * -0.0208603044412437f + y * -0.3155296974329846f + z * -0.316227766016838f + w * -0.44721359549995804f + u * -0.7745966692414836f;

2794        float xin = p1;
2795        float yin = p2;
2796        float zin = p3;
2797        float win = p4;
2798        float uin = p5;
2799        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin, win, uin);
2800        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2801        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2802        xin = p0;
2803        yin = p2;
2804        zin = p3;
2805        win = p4;
2806        uin = p5;
2807        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin, win, uin);
2808        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2809        seed ^= seed >>> 14;

2811        yin = p1;
2812        zin = p3;
2813        win = p4;
2814        uin = p5;
2815        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin, win, uin);

2817        seed ^= seed >>> 14;

2821        win = p4;

2909    private float singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2910        int seed = this.seed;
2911        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
2912        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2913            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleFoam(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u, v));
2914            correction += (exp *= 0.5f);
2915            sum += spike * exp;
2916            x *= lacunarity;
2917            y *= lacunarity;
2918            z *= lacunarity;
2919            w *= lacunarity;
2920            u *= lacunarity;
2921            v *= lacunarity;
2922        }
2923        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
2924    }

2930    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2931        final float p0 = x;
2932        final float p1 = x * -0.16666666666666666f + y *  0.98601329718326940f;
2933        final float p2 = x * -0.16666666666666666f + y * -0.19720265943665383f + z *  0.96609178307929590f;
2934        final float p3 = x * -0.16666666666666666f + y * -0.19720265943665383f + z * -0.24152294576982394f + w *  0.93541434669348530f;
2935        final float p4 = x * -0.16666666666666666f + y * -0.19720265943665383f + z * -0.24152294576982394f + w * -0.31180478223116176f + u *  0.8819171036881969f;
2936        final float p5 = x * -0.16666666666666666f + y * -0.19720265943665383f + z * -0.24152294576982394f + w * -0.31180478223116176f + u * -0.4409585518440984f + v *  0.7637626158259734f;
2937        final float p6 = x * -0.16666666666666666f + y * -0.19720265943665383f + z * -0.24152294576982394f + w * -0.31180478223116176f + u * -0.4409585518440984f + v * -0.7637626158259732f;
2938        float xin = p0;
2939        float yin = p5;
2940        float zin = p3;
2941        float win = p6;
2942        float uin = p1;
2943        float vin = p4;
2944        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
2945        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2946        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2947        xin = p2;
2948        yin = p6;
2949        zin = p0;
2950        win = p4;
2951        uin = p5;
2952        vin = p3;
2953        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
2954        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2955        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2956        xin = p1;
2957        yin = p2;
2958        zin = p3;
2959        win = p4;
2960        uin = p6;
2961        vin = p5;
2962        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
2963        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2964        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2965        xin = p6;
2966        yin = p0;
2967        zin = p2;
2968        win = p5;
2969        uin = p4;
2970        vin = p1;
2971        final float d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
2972        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2973        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2974        xin = p2;
2975        yin = p1;
2976        zin = p5;
2977        win = p0;
2978        uin = p3;
2979        vin = p6;
2980        final float e = valueNoise(seed, xin + d, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
2981        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2982        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2983        xin = p0;
2984        yin = p4;
2985        zin = p6;
2986        win = p3;
2987        uin = p1;
2988        vin = p2;
2989        final float f = valueNoise(seed, xin + e, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
2990        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2991        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2992        xin = p5;
2993        yin = p1;
2994        zin = p2;
2995        win = p3;
2996        uin = p4;
2997        vin = p0;
2998        final float g = valueNoise(seed, xin + f, yin, zin, win, uin, vin);
2999        final float result = (a + b + c + d + e + f + g) * 0.14285714285714285f;
3000        final float sharp = foamSharpness * 6.6f;
3001        final float diff = 0.5f - result;
3002        final int sign = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(diff) >> 31, one = sign | 1;
3003        return (((result + sign)) / (Float.MIN_VALUE - sign + (result + sharp * diff) * one) - sign - sign) - 1f;
3004    }

3007    public float getPerlinFractal(float x, float y) {
3008        x *= frequency;
3009        y *= frequency;
3010
3011        switch (fractalType) {
3012            case FBM:
3013                return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y);
3014            case BILLOW:
3015                return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y);
3016            case RIDGED_MULTI:
3017                return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
3018            default:
3019                return 0;
3020        }
3021    }

3023    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
3024        int seed = this.seed;
3025        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y);
3026        float amp = 1;
3027
3028        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3029            x *= lacunarity;
3030            y *= lacunarity;
3031
3032            amp *= gain;
3033            sum += singlePerlin(++seed, x, y) * amp;
3034        }
3035
3036        return sum * fractalBounding;
3037    }
3038
3039    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
3040        int seed = this.seed;
3041        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
3042        float amp = 1;
3043
3044        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3045            if(fractalSpiral){
3046                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
3047                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
3048                x = x2; y = y2;
3049            }
3050            x *= lacunarity;
3051            y *= lacunarity;
3052
3053            amp *= gain;
3054            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
3055        }
3056
3057        return sum * fractalBounding;
3058    }

3060    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
3061        int seed = this.seed;
3062        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
3063        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
3064            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y));
3065            correction += (exp *= 0.5f);
3066            sum += spike * exp;
3067            if(fractalSpiral){
3068                final float x2 = rotateX2D(x, y);
3069                final float y2 = rotateY2D(x, y);
3070                x = x2; y = y2;
3071            }
3072            x *= lacunarity;
3073            y *= lacunarity;
3074        }
3075        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
3076    }

3082    private float singlePerlin(int seed, float x, float y) {
3083        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
3084        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
3085        int x1 = x0 + 1;
3086        int y1 = y0 + 1;
3087
3088        float xs, ys;
3089        switch (interpolation) {
3090            default:
3091            case LINEAR:
3092                xs = x - x0;
3093                ys = y - y0;
3094                break;
3095            case HERMITE:
3096                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
3097                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
3098                break;
3099            case QUINTIC:
3100                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
3101                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
3102                break;
3103        }
3104
3105        float xd0 = x - x0;
3106        float yd0 = y - y0;
3107        float xd1 = xd0 - 1;
3108        float yd1 = yd0 - 1;
3109
3110        float xf0 = lerp(gradCoord2D(seed, x0, y0, xd0, yd0), gradCoord2D(seed, x1, y0, xd1, yd0), xs);
3111        float xf1 = lerp(gradCoord2D(seed, x0, y1, xd0, yd1), gradCoord2D(seed, x1, y1, xd1, yd1), xs);
3112
3113        return lerp(xf0, xf1, ys);
3114    }

3131    }

3377    private float singlePerlin(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {

3385        int z1 = z0 + 1;

3387        int u1 = u0 + 1;
3388        
3389        float xs, ys, zs, ws, us;
3390        switch (interpolation) {
3391            default:
3392            case LINEAR:
3393                xs = x - x0;
3394                ys = y - y0;
3395                zs = z - z0;
3396                ws = w - w0;
3397                us = u - u0;
3398                break;
3399            case HERMITE:
3400                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
3401                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
3402                zs = hermiteInterpolator(z - z0);
3403                ws = hermiteInterpolator(w - w0);
3404                us = hermiteInterpolator(u - u0);
3405                break;
3406            case QUINTIC:
3407                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
3408                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
3409                zs = quinticInterpolator(z - z0);

3411                us = quinticInterpolator(u - u0);
3412                break;

3462    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
3463        int seed = this.seed;
3464        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w, u);
3465        float amp = 1;
3466
3467        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3468            x *= lacunarity;
3469            y *= lacunarity;
3470            z *= lacunarity;
3471            w *= lacunarity;
3472            u *= lacunarity;
3473
3474            amp *= gain;
3475            sum += singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u) * amp;
3476        }
3477
3478        return sum * fractalBounding;
3479    }
3480
3481    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
3482        int seed = this.seed;
3483        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1;
3484        float amp = 1;
3485
3486        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
3487            if(fractalSpiral){
3488                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3489                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3490                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3491                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3492                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3493                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
3494            }
3495            x *= lacunarity;
3496            y *= lacunarity;
3497            z *= lacunarity;
3498            w *= lacunarity;
3499            u *= lacunarity;
3500
3501            amp *= gain;
3502            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
3503        }
3504
3505        return sum * fractalBounding;
3506    }
3507
3508    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
3509        int seed = this.seed;
3510        float sum = 0f, exp = 2f, correction = 0f, spike;
3511        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
3512            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u));
3513            correction += (exp *= 0.5f);
3514            sum += spike * exp;
3515            if(fractalSpiral){
3516                final float x2 = rotateX5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3517                final float y2 = rotateY5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3518                final float z2 = rotateZ5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3519                final float w2 = rotateW5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3520                final float u2 = rotateU5D(x, y, z, w, u);
3521                x = x2; y = y2; z = z2; w = w2; u = u2;
3522            }
3523            x *= lacunarity;
3524            y *= lacunarity;
3525            z *= lacunarity;
3526            w *= lacunarity;
3527            u *= lacunarity;
3528        }
3529        return sum * 2f / correction - 1f;
3530    }

3540    public float getPerlin(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
3541        return singlePerlin(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency, u * frequency, v * frequency);
3542    }
